page.title: 01CATON,BROOKHOUSE+LITTLEDALE
page.content: The parish of Caton-with-Littledale is found 7 kilometres east of Lancaster, in an area of outstanding natural beauty.There are around 1200 homes. The land slopes north from Clougha Pike and Wardstone to the wooded valley of Artlebeck,rising again to Caton Moor, then descending to the River Lune.Much is farm land.The valley consists of good pasture land which is used for dairy cattle,whilst the hills,which are rocky,are used for sheep and beef farming.Most of the dwellings are in the valley adjacent to the River Lune in the two communities of Caton and Brookhouse.They serve as dormitories for Lancaster and other towns. Littledale is a farming community in the hills where nearly all the inhabitants are related to each other.
